Package com.atakmap.android.toolbar

Class Tool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.toolbar.Tool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.view.View.OnKeyListener, Disposable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMapItemSelectionTool, ButtonTool, CircleCreationTool, DrawingRectangleCreationTool, DynamicRangeAndBearingTool, EnterLocationTool, GridTool, LaserBasketDisplayTool, MapClickTool, MapItemSelectTool, MapPointTool, MovePointTool, PolylineSelectTool, RangeAndBearingEndpointMoveTool, RegionShapeTool, RouteConfirmationTool, ShapeCreationTool, SpecialPointButtonTool, SpecifyLockItemTool, SpecifySelfLocationTool, TelestrationTool
    public abstract class Tool
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.view.View.OnKeyListener, Disposable
    A Tool is a modal operation which changes the way that the user interacts with the map. Only one tool can be active at a time; if the user starts a new tool, the old tool ends.

    • Method Detail

      • onToolBegin

        protected boolean onToolBegin​(android.os.Bundle extras)
        Called when this tool has been asked to start (and after the last tool has cleaned up)
        Parameters:
        extras - extra params that were passed by the GUI
        Returns:
        true if tool is now active, false if it has already finished.

      • onToolEnd

        protected void onToolEnd()
        Called when this tool has been asked to end, either directly or by the user selecting a new tool or possibly a new toolbar.

      • dispose

        public abstract void dispose()
        Called only by the parent during final cleanup activities.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable

      • endTool

        protected void endTool()
        Used by ToolbarLibrary to stop a running tool. Shouldn't be called directly, instead send an END_TOOL intent or use the requestEndTool() method which sends such an intent.

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Returns the identifier used to refer to this tool in intents.
        Returns:

      • shouldEndOnBack

        public boolean shouldEndOnBack()
        Returns whether this tool should end when the back button is pressed.
        Returns:

      • requestBeginTool

        public void requestBeginTool()
        Helper method to send the intent required to ask the ToolbarLibrary to make this tool active. You can call this if you need to start your tool.

      • requestEndTool

        public void requestEndTool()
        Helper method to send the intent required to ask the ToolbarLibrary to make this tool inactive. You can call this if you need to stop your tool while it's running.

      • getActive

        public boolean getActive()
        Returns whether the tool is currently active, ie, onToolBegin has been called but onToolEnd has not yet been called. In most cases the tool's button's selected state should reflect this value.
        Returns:

      • setActive

        protected void setActive​(boolean active)
        Called to set whether a tool is actively being used. Generally, this should be automatically handled by the onToolBegin(), onToolEnd() life cycle. Override to update GUI elements to reflect the new value.

      • clearExtraListeners

        protected void clearExtraListeners()
        Clears all listeners from the map except for those involved with fundamental map operations, ie pan and pinch.

      • pushMapListeners

        protected void pushMapListeners()
        Push a new set of map listeners while tracking the current push count

      • popMapListeners

        protected void popMapListeners()
        Pop a set of map listeners while tracking the current push count

      • popAllMapListeners

        protected void popAllMapListeners()
        Pop all map listeners that were pushed with this tool

      • findPoint

        protected GeoPointMetaData findPoint​(MapEvent event)
        Helper method that finds a point given a map event (i.e. map click)
        Parameters:
        event - Map event
        Returns:
        Point or null if not found TODO: Probably should get the actual touch point of both the terrain and the model as two different things so that the user of this tool can decide what makes the most sense to use.
